intro: Jacquemontia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant has a trailing growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive, velvety appearance. Jacquemontia velutina is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and woodland edges.
